padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349615">Juliet Sistine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-18">08/18/24 11:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lily of the valley and cucumber soap. Pretty but needs something, like fruit (ie. imagine cucumber melon scents without melon?). Wish they could turn up the peach (hardly notice it). Nice but could be wonderful if I found the right thing to add :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2253355"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2253355#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2250706" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2250706" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MiKi_moo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1255599"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MiKi_moo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2250706ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2250706" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1255599">MiKi_moo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-15">08/15/24 18:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I cant understand the hype of this. Clean girl fragrance? Absolutely not. This is a screeching, loud, banshee of a scent. I felt like this fragrance was attacking me, and it would not come off.  I have tried it twice, thinking that maybe the first time was just a fluke and my nose was off that day. Some of the fragrance notes are unknown to me, but the ones I do know are mostly right up my alley so I thought this was a safe buy. <br />
Aldehydes, Petalia, Nympheal and Mahonia; Akigalawood: one or more of these is violent. <br />
Vanilla? There is not one second of a hint of vanilla in this. <br />
And this comes from someone who would bathe in bergamot and most other citrus scents, loves a unisex fragrance, loves green, resiny, clean fragrances - I even enjoy the smell of gasoline. Frankly, wearing gasoline would have been more pleasant for my brain. <br />
Not a safe blind buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2250706"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2250706#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2249002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219962">bkingstar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-14">08/14/24 10:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the scent I have been dreaming of all my life. I wasn't drawn to it immediately but as I returned to it after it dried down, I felt like I had been graced by the presence of an angel. When people think of me, I want them to smell this. A man would think about you for the rest of his life if he smelled this on you. It makes me feel otherworldly, like I've transcended human form and am the embodiment of everything that is beautiful in the world. It is a spiritual and religious experience every time I wear this. It smells like the color light blue, swans, doves, flower fields, clouds, air, sun, and everything that is pure and fresh. This will be with me until I croak and will be my wedding scent </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2249002"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2249002#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2247899" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1355493">Lilinmorales</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-13">08/13/24 10:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Valaya is a a very elegant, clean, and ladylike fragrance that exudes sophistication.  Don't underestimate its projection power-this scent is definitely going to make its presence known.  Initially, I hesitated to get it because, despite loving it, I thought it might cause me nasal fatigue.  However, I found myself constantly sniffing my wrist, captivated by the scent, and eventually decided I had to have a bottle all for myself .<br />
Mystique Bouquet from Afnan is a very good affordable option, you are welcome!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2247899"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2247899#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2247689" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2131204">Ozzysniffer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-13">08/13/24 06:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If this fragrance had a sound, it would be children learning to play the recorder... badly... for like 12 hours... non stop. To my nose, the fragrance is screechy and relentless. <br />
<br />
Based on descriptions I thought I'd love Valaya, but it's a hard pass from me. This stuff is nuclear! One spray absolutely suffocated me <br />
I don't know if there's a note in the PDM DNA that doesn't agree with my nose. I didn't enjoy Delina Exclusif either. I actually felt like Valaya smelled like a stripped back version Delina Exclusif - without the rose or rhubarb.<br />
<br />
Objectively I can tell that these are nice fragrances, but I don't enjoy them.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2247689"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2247689#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2245882" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2245882" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ambervxyjul"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598318"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1598318.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ambervxyjul" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2245882ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2245882" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598318">ambervxyjul</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-11">08/11/24 10:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The best clean girl scent without smelling too much like citrus and/or crisp clean. It smells like an angel, very delicate and soft. I adore peach in fragrances and this one does not disappoint. This profile is surprisingly very strong and two sprays lasted the whole day on me! Signature worthy, and can be worn any time/any hour etc. The best fresh scent you will find on the market!<br />
<br />
I have mystique bouquet by Afnan (the dupe) and it smells 80% similar. Valaya is more refined and delicate but if you wanted to save some bucks I would recommend the dupe!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2245882"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2245882#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2243879" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2243879" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="simlai33"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1440432"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1440432.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="simlai33" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2243879ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2243879" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1440432">simlai33</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-09">08/09/24 09:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Feminine and intimate, very private as it heats up with you throughout the day or it lingers on the skin waiting to be light up with emotions and movement... Peach, musk and aldehydes just work together in this combination for a very 'urban woman', elegant, classy, sexy-young vibe...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2243879"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2243879#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2241931" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2241931" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="milkteafairy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1761948"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1761948.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="milkteafairy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2241931ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2241931" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1761948">milkteafairy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-07">08/07/24 12:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Etheral this is what angels smell like. It is slightly peachy and soft like a warm blanket. <br />
I am not really fond of citrusy/clean fragrances but it is clean, but in the best, most feminine way possible.<br />
The longevity is great. Took a shower and I still smell it 7 hours later. Although the projection isnt the best, I only sprayed it once on my hand.<br />
I cant categorize it because it is a little soft, a tiny bit peachy, and also clean. It just smells like an angel. This is a beautiful fragrance. <br />
The bottle colour is fitting. Its white because its an angel with its white wings in a bottle lol</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2241931"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2241931#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2240538" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2240538" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bee91"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1087847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1087847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bee91" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2240538ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2240538" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1087847">Bee91</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-06">08/06/24 07:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fluffy, peachy vanilla musk. Very creamy, very "sweater weather" appropriate.<br />
It's nuanced and well blended, but the general impression is something soft, sweet and cozy. <br />
<br />
It's not cloying or overly sweet, but I wouldn't necessarily say it's a fresh scent either. Can be worn all year round, but fall seems most appropriate.<br />
<br />
Lasting power is good (6-7 hours on skin), and has one hell of a grip on clothes.<br />
Sampled through a discovery set.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2240538"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2240538#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2238311" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Perfect for spring and summer. To my nose, it goes on the same line with Dior J'adore L'or. I've been comparing both perfumes side by side earlier today. While I love both, Valaya's dry down is muskier, tiny bit sweeter, and overall more sophisticated. Valaya is totally on my top list. Also, this is a compliment getter. :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2238311"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2238311#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2238207" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2235908"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2235908#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2233456" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2233456" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BRoom212"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1622092"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1622092.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BRoom212" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stephane-Humbert-Lucas-777/God-of-Fire-72381.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72381.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="God of Fire"title="God of Fire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2233456ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2233456" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1622092">BRoom212</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-30">07/30/24 03:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I generally dislike aldehydes so I didnt rush to sample this one. I do appreciate Quentin Bisch creations hence I decided to give it a try in the end.<br />
<br />
Valaya starts off citrusy then grows sweeter and settles into a soft musk, orange blossom is noticeable through the mid and the synthetic undertones are tastefully done. <br />
<br />
The musk-bergamot in this is very similar to Fugazzis Angel Dust which I own and like better (as its much more unisex).<br />
<br />
That being said, the composition feels a bit flat and unimpressive, more so at the price this retails for. Soft sillage and decent longevity, feminine scent.<br />
<br />
Wont add this to my collection, but Im glad to have sampled it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2233456"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2233456#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2230791" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; UNICORN!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2230791"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2230791#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2229660" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2229660" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ayywolf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1946008"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1946008.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ayywolf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2229660ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2229660" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1946008">ayywolf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-25">07/25/24 23:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I usually don't comment on women's fragrances but my sister happened to get this one based on my recommendation (I hadn't smelled it, I just liked the notes and PDM) and it could not have been a better choice. She loves it, this fragrance is insanely good. It is so high quality, pushes out so much, but it's not annoying or offensive at all. It's light, floral, bit fruity scent that isn't overly sweet or super "girly". I'm beginning to think that popular women's fragrances are not as complex, I smell the exact same frgarances on the street, but this one will stand out, I promise. It's nothing out of the ordinary, but unique enough to draw people closer. I can't recommend this one enough, go easy on the sprays though, this stuff is very strong if applied too excessively.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2229660"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2229660#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2229364" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2229364" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Patr70"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1788173"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Patr70" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2229364ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2229364" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1788173">Patr70</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-25">07/25/24 14:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reading these reviews, I get the impression that once a really good fragrance such as Parfums de Marly "Valaya" gets really popular, you can then get people who are used to "overly sugared cheap" perfumes that a teenager wears trying out the [said] popular perfume.. which then results in many of the negative reviews you see below.   PDM "Valaya" and Amouage "Guidance" were the biggest hits of 2023 in the fragrance world, so take what I said above, into consideration. 8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2229364"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2229364#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2228797" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2228797" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="violeteme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1387189.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="violeteme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sisley/Sisley-Eau-de-3-5852.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5852.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sisley Eau de 3"title="Sisley Eau de 3"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2228797ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2228797" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387189">violeteme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-25">07/25/24 03:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Valaya is an impression image, a fantasy rather than something literal. It is a bedroom with freshly washed white quality linens, a pearly body cream, a hairspray, application of powdery products on your skin while still in a silk robe, it's a scent of orange blossoms and other blooms brought inside by a soft breeze. It's all in Valaya at once, this princess-like morning moment in one spray.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2228797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2228797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2228136" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2228136" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maiiraa77"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1813223"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1813223.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maiiraa77" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2228136ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2228136" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1813223">maiiraa77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-24">07/24/24 11:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As someone who doesn't usually like musks, I find this to dry down into quite a nice soft plush skin scent. The combination of the fruits and the florals are not too stand out but blend to give something feminine leaning that is neither too fruity and juvenile or sickly sweet and flowery. It started out more fresh and floral for sure. <br />
<br />
Haven't decided what I think about the price but I do appreciate that it comes in 30mL as I find it projects very well for at least 3-4 hours and still remains strong but closer to the skin thereafter. One of the few perfumes that someone has commented whilst sitting across me about 2 hours after I sprayed it on (that I wore through a hot day on the tube home), so that says something (my skin literally eats most perfumes I wear). I think it will suit all occasions and seasons but I wish there was something slightly more unique to be able to call it signature worthy. I think I will end up getting a 30mL though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2228136"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2228136#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2226621" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2226621" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="patricianicole"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2193022"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="patricianicole" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2226621ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2226621" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); There is some sophistication, but it has and undertone of household cleaner. Plus the musk is too heavy, which spoils the "cleanliness" of the fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2226621"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2226621#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2226311" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2224207"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2224207#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2223627" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2223627" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nataliemarie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/273464"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.273464.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nataliemarie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Thomas-Kosmala/Apres-l-Amour-53742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aprs lAmour"title="Aprs lAmour"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2223627ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2223627" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/273464">Nataliemarie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-19">07/19/24 15:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I smelled this on me in Neiman's, I was in LOVE. Now I have it &amp; one spray is almost too much. Not b/c it's strong, it's just "enough" I can't even describe it. I get a screechy cotton freshie.  The peach is so far in the background to me, I'd never pick it out. Delina is the only other PDM I have &amp; it's a fail for sure. I think Valaya smells good, but I'd get tired of it if I had to smell it all day. I'll wear it out when I know I'm gonna be somewhere I usually can't smell myself, but others can. I think the weirdness of it might be that paint-ish smell. It's odd.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2223627"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2223627#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2221972" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2221972" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marialena888m"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1135263"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1135263.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="marialena888m" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/Splendida-Magnolia-Sensuel-47820.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47820.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Splendida Magnolia Sensuel"title="Splendida Magnolia Sensuel"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2221972ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2221972" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1135263">marialena888m</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-18">07/18/24 02:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Checks every box for me<br />
- Phenomenal longevity and sillage (1 week + on clothes, and still radiating its fragrance)<br />
- Clean, musky, floral, woody, peachy, very feminine<br />
- Distinctive and unforgettable <br />
- Crowd pleasing (side note: men are especially drawn to it, more so than women, so if that matters to you, this one is great for dates too)<br />
- Great for all year round<br />
- Works in any occasion <br />
The only con is you can get sick of it if accidentally oversprayed. Its deceptively a light freshie at first but its actually a beast, that akigalawood in the drydown is reminiscent of the drydown of Amouage Guidance, so do not blind buy. 2 sprays is enough for me, and Im usually an over-sprayer. Worth every penny if you enjoy the scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2221972"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2221972#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2221821" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2221821" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kharber1993"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2106649"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2106649.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kharber1993" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2221821ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2221821" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2106649">kharber1993</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-17">07/17/24 20:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted to love this since my husband loves this on me. There is something in this that smells like paint. The only thing else I smell is the musk. I dont get any fruit or flowers. It is very strong, heavy, and last until you wash it off. If you work close to people or in an open office setting, be careful on how much you spray because it doesnt take much to fill the room giving everyone a migraine. I wore it to work once with just spraying both my wrist, both sides of my neck. Everyone in the room could smell me and not in a good way. Thankfully I live close to my work and have an hour for lunch because I went home and washed it off. Only for special occasions. Its a little better when you pair it with other fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2221821"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2221821#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2221522" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2221522" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SimonsTux"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1456639"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SimonsTux" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Bianco-Latte-64757.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64757.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bianco Latte"title="Bianco Latte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2221522ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2221522" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1456639">SimonsTux</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-17">07/17/24 13:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Omg I hate this. If you love it, I'm happy for you. I get rubbing alcohol. Make it go away. Blind buy fail. I guess "clean", aldehydic is not for me. Lasts forever though. Please sample first.<br />
<br />
$200-250 on discounters (fragnet, OFFLLC)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2221522"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2221522#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2221319" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2221319" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aland2020"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1187053"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1187053.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aland2020" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Moonlight-in-Heaven-35973.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35973.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Moonlight in Heaven"title="Moonlight in Heaven"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2221319ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2221319" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1187053">Aland2020</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-17">07/17/24 09:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, what a mess. This smells like what all the negative reviews were saying. I normally don't read reviews before writing my own but I really couldn't express what was happening on my skin, and I was perplexed. It's a peachy synthetic musky mess. The aldehyde musk combo does smell like a bleach on steroids. This is what Not A Perfume would probably evolve into when she gets married and becomes a rich D***** bag's housewife. This is for the person who buys all neutral beige baby toys. An all white bouncy castle for the 1st birthday party, nevermind that the child can't even walk yet. Dresses her children in suspendered shorts, boat shoes, and a button down or cotillion dress and white tights year round. Hosts tea parties in the garden and gets drunk at noon because the nanny will fetch the children for their baths in time for a dinner to feed 45 people and all she eats is a fork full of rice and half a piece of asparagus then claims she's full. Her husband hasn't been home in 3 nights because he's been stuck at the office closing a business deal and his secretary Sarah has to be there with him. <br />
<br />
This is for the woman who has now gotten older and gets a seasoned employee at Neiman Marcus fired for accidentally sneezing in her presence and then cries during Sunday Service about God's enduring grace and love. She tries on dresses at her daughter's wedding gown fitting. She cries in the hospital holding her first grandchild, hoping she looks the part but on the inside she's seething with rage because she's been in denial all these years about her true age and has had enough botox injected in her smile lines to calm the aftershocks of a 4.7 earthquake. She insists the child call her "Gigi", she now has a fluffy white dog that she takes everywhere in her crocodile Birkin bag and they eat off of the same fork at restaurants. Her husband died of a heart attack in his sleep many years ago, and she has never taken another lover. She lives comfortably in their house with that beautiful garden. Sarah died of mysterious causes, and so did many of her husbands secretaries, it must have been all the stress that her husband put them through. But all of the begonias she planted in their honor bloom yearly and make her smile. <br />
<br />
She dies and donates all of her riches and wealth to charity, with a long speech about righting wrongs read to her room full of children and grandchildren as they sob with the realization they'll be left with nothing. Her final request is that they bury her in the cream Chanel suit and spray her generously with Valaya, then they tuck the bottle and her taxidermied pooch under her arms and close the casket. <br />
<br />
Whatever petalia is I want to be sure I never try another perfume with it. It's clearly sent me on some psychosis-laced journey of horror. You wanna know how it smells? Cold and heartless served up with a slice of peach pie and a glass of bleach water. Like someone stuck their head inside of a dryer filled with fluffy white towels and then asphyxiated and died.I'm sure that on some people it's a sweet dream, yet on me it was a nightmare that I hope to never experience again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2221319"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2221319#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2218773" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2218773" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ke3ke3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2101926"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2101926.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ke3ke3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Crivelli/Iris-Malikhan-62617.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62617.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Malikhn"title="Iris Malikhn"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2218773ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2218773" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2101926">ke3ke3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-14">07/14/24 18:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dont know if its the petalia, Im not familiar with that note, but Valaya smells just like Cassili to my nose. Like, eerily so. Not sure if its something with my skin chemistry, or if Im particularly sensitive to petalia (whatever that even is), but the two perfumes dry down freakishly similar to me. However, Valaya makes my throat sore, Cassili does not. That said, I think I slightly prefer Valaya. I find them both to be screechy. Or sharp. Its just a smell I find bothersome Im not prone to headaches, but I imagine if something were to give me one, it would be Cassili or Valaya. Ive not read the comments yet, but I HAVE to imagine others have noticed the same as I have in regards to Cassili Valaya.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2218773"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2218773#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2217364" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2217364" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Laura444"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2193056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Laura444" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2217364ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2217364" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2193056">Laura444</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-13">07/13/24 06:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like my grandmas soviet panel after putting a fresh load to dry on the racks, cleaned with cheap detergent that was made to smell elegant but really it just overpowering and musty. The smell stays the same throughout the whole wear imo. It can work as a handsoap though</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2217364"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2217364#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2216584" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2216584" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cgaleb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753541"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1753541.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cgaleb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Dulcis-in-Fundo-3890.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3890.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dulcis in Fundo"title="Dulcis in Fundo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2216584ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2216584" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753541">cgaleb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-12">07/12/24 11:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Valaya is quite pretty, it has a sparkly essence to it from the aldehydes, a sweet peach, and some nondescript florals to round things out. It has an airiness to it, but yet is quite powerful in sillage and longevity. As it wears I pick up some powderiness and more florals, less peach. I can see why this is so popular, as its pretty and well done. However, this type of profile is just not for me, though I enjoyed sampling it. I definitely do not recommend a blind buy for Valaya, as Ive heard it often described as screechy (and while I dont get that I can see why some could feel that way about it) and its price point is quite high. Definitely sample this one first. Lasts forever!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2216584"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2216584#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2216556" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Too bad</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2216556"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2216556#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2216219" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
