Now I have backups for when you are empty! Seriously though. A fragrance hasn't made me this happy in years. Valaya is bottled joy...a liquid antidepressant. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2135890"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2135890#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2135258" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2135258" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ambervxyjul"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598318"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1598318.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ambervxyjul" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2135258ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2135258" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598318">ambervxyjul</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-24">04/24/24 14:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful and signature worthy. Its Delina but without the  rose notes. Bright, fresh and slightly sweet. Its a powerhouse scent for this type of dna. It smells exactly how the bottle looks. Transparent, ethereal, elegant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2135258"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2135258#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2133825" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2133825" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JasmineSky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1646147"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1646147.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JasmineSky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/House-of-BO/Rosario-78779.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78779.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rosario"title="Rosario"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2133825ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2133825" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1646147">JasmineSky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 10:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So sharp and heady, this one will give you a headache! Overall it's not a bad scent. I feel like I'm not a fan of aldehydes, especially mixed with so many florals- ugh, it's overwhelming. I felt the same with the og delina too. Glad I tried it out, but it's a no for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2133825"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2133825#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2131026" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2131026" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eau de dosa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1313456"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1313456.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eau de dosa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2131026ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2131026" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1313456">eau de dosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 19:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive have my bottle for a while now and have debated about it. I like this however its something in it that bothers me. As Im reading through the reviews below, it dawned on me that the dry down is a deep floral soapy scent thats heady and it aggravates me when I get whiffs.<br />
<br />
With that being said, I dont know if Ill depart with Ms. Valaya or not. Shes a distant relative of Chanel - a young chick that likes Russian tea cake cookies, afternoon tea and goes to bed at 6pm.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2131026"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2131026#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130723" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2130723" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ieva_M"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2102167"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2102167.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ieva_M" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Muse-55161.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55161.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Muse"title="Muse"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2130723ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2130723" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2102167">Ieva_M</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 13:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favourite juice in my collection ! I cant say it is floral, for me its a bright musky citrus scent and it keeps that way in a dry down. Yet I can smell a little bit of vanilla so it makes the fragrance a bit sweeter. It is very sparkly scent and I can see where people going when they say it is has Delinas dna. For me its very much like Delina just without that jammy rose. It projects amazing and longevity is a beast. Just for the quality and performance I think this perfume even fair rated price wise.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2130723"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2130723#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130596" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2130596" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CrissyCK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388879"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1388879.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CrissyCK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Another-13-10131.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10131.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Another 13"title="Another 13"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2130596ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2130596" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388879">CrissyCK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 10:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im not sure what to say about this one. Its different sweet and soft but its like the old lady version of Delina. Yet it is a bit addicting, which I think is due to the ambroxin (love). For the price, Ill pass. I cant get past the old lady smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2130596"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2130596#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2129075" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2129075" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AleksOud"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/911691"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.911691.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AleksOud" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2129075ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2129075" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/911691">AleksOud</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-18">04/18/24 20:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Starts like a sophisticated fresh floral for spring/summer, an experienced perfume afficionado will recognize citrus, white flowers,  woods and musk. Middle notes show fresh aldehydes, laundry powder style on top of the other notes. The drydown is an intense laundry powder style scent and this is where it lost me. Try Laundrette by Frau Tonis instead, I think that it does the flower-fresh aldehydes combination much better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2129075"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2129075#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2128474" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2128474" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Frangipanilove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/528960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.528960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Frangipanilove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Aqua-Vitae-Forte-31404.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31404.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Vitae Forte"title="Aqua Vitae Forte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2128474ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2128474" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/528960">Frangipanilove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-18">04/18/24 09:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Some Delina dna here, not as a rose but as a similar layering of different facets. Spritzy bergamot/citrus on top, with floral (imaginary floral notes) and barely detectable peach in the middle, and a musk base with some softness from vanilla though this is by no means a sweet fragrance. Its difficult to pinpoint specific scents / notes with this one - I prefer real flowers to imaginary flower notes however- prevents fragrances from veering too much to the augmented reality direction. One for spring and summer but overall, too artificial to my taste, becoming sharp and pointed over drydown.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2128474"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2128474#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2126958" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2126958" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mrntrs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460141"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1460141.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mrntrs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2126958ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2126958" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460141">mrntrs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-16">04/16/24 20:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am a PdM lover and therefore assumed I would love Valaya. I absolutely do not! The notes sound beautiful on paper but theres something about the base that makes it really unpleasant to my nose. As someone else also commented, I usually enjoy musky scents so this was surprising. I wore it twice to convince myself that it wasnt that bad but its still a no for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2126958"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2126958#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2126495" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2126495" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NickiGB"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1499320"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1499320.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NickiGB" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mon-Guerlain-Eau-de-Parfum-Intense-55997.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55997.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Guerlain Eau de Parfum Intense"title="Mon Guerlain Eau de Parfum Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2126495ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2126495" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1499320">NickiGB</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-16">04/16/24 10:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm quite honestly shocked at the negative reviews here. Maybe this one does depend on body chemistry. I don't get "old lady" at all and in no way is this masculine. It's as if Fleur Narcotique and Levant had a baby. But add a little woodiness at the base. The musk is fluffy, the fruity florals are sweet but not too sweet, and the performance is outstanding on me. I've been wearing this non-stop all spring and it will work for summer as well. I also think this could make a perfect bridal scent, or signature scent. And the bottle... stunning.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2126495"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2126495#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2124564" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2124564" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="larabk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683191"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1683191.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="larabk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2124564ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2124564" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); Very clean</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2124564"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2124564#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123937" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2123937" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cats_eye"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/991427"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.991427.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cats_eye" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Musk-of-Flowers-15206.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15206.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musk of Flowers"title="Musk of Flowers"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2123937ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2123937" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); Burberry in the round bottle from 1995! Valaya is a little stronger. They both have that peachy, orange blossom, cedar, vetiver, vanilla musk combo. I knew it reminded me of something.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2123937"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2123937#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2122862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Valaya feels harsh and masculine to me. It is a chemical mess that sticks to your clothes for weeks to give you headache.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2122859"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2122859#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2120031" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2120031" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="VeroMikaela"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1099972"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1099972.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="VeroMikaela" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rosendo-Mateu-Olfactive-Expressions/1970-80352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1970"title="1970"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2120031ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2120031" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1099972">VeroMikaela</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-10">04/10/24 01:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A few sprays of  Valaya and suddenly you have the impression that you are eating lemon with sugar... Aldehydes in a large amount and bergamot. After about an hour in which it remains linear and constant, it turns into a strange perfume that you could only describe as synthetic, but not in the pejorative sense of the word when it comes to perfumes. A crystalline, glacial smell. Probably those petalia and nympheal potentiated by a considerable dose of ambroxan. Although I am not attracted to the genre at all, I cannot deny a certain dose of alluring that it exerts on the wearer.<br />
Above average longevity, satisfying projection</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2120031"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2120031#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2118592" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2118592" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="26071980"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1996262"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1996262.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="26071980" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2118592ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2118592" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1996262">26071980</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-08">04/08/24 16:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I liked it at first . But then i sprayed my self after a shower, and the minute i stepped out in a windy sunny day, i just wanted to go back home, and wash it off me that old lady smell. Ohh i was suffering  I guess that was the lily of the valley ( although i like the flower) , or maybe its the mahonia  its just not working for me. Many people like it though. Not a safe blind buy for sure!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2118592"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2118592#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2116919" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2116919" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jadelynn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/839191"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.839191.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jadelynn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Acqua-di-Parma-Blu-Mediterraneo-Fico-di-Amalfi-1687.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1687.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Fico di Amalfi"title="Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Fico di Amalfi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2116919ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2116919" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/839191">Jadelynn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-07">04/07/24 01:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've tried only two of PdM's offerings so far, but I'm thinking this house may not be for me. Besides Valaya, I've had a decant of Delina Exclusif, and I found them both way too powdery.<br />
<br />
While I can appreciate that Valaya is a pleasant fragrance, it's intensely powdery and doesn't work for the tropical climate I live in. It doesn't help that projection is quite strong; the performance on this one is impressive in terms of both sillage and longevity. I could still smell this on my skin after I showered at night, and it was still on my skin for several hours after waking the next day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2116919"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2116919#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2115170" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2115170" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jazzyjuice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2066001"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2066001.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jazzyjuice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2115170ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2115170" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2066001">jazzyjuice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-05">04/05/24 08:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>if you're looking for a fresh and clean fragrance but don't like the screechy dryer sheet aldehydes of 724 by MFK, this is the scent for you. the first hour is very masculine, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, just something to note. at no point does this fragrance smell super feminine on my skin, after the first hour it leans more unisex, but i'm not sure why this is marketed towards women. to me, this scent smells like James Bond getting out of the shower. the vanilla in the base is definitely a whisper, but i say that as a compliment because it's just this barely radiating sweetness that emerges in the dry down that makes this wearable year round, perfect for daytime and someone confident looking for a fresh and clean fragrance. i would definitely say this is worth the price if you're looking for a masculine-leaning bright, sexy, and refreshing unisex fragrance that you won't smell a lot on others. well done PDM</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2115170"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2115170#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2114137" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2114137" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="riri92000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.72528.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="riri92000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Flora-by-Gucci-Gorgeous-Gardenia-14395.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14395.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia"title="Flora by Gucci Gorgeous Gardenia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2114137ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2114137" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72528">riri92000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-04">04/04/24 09:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nothing special at all, I really feel this trend of overhyping niche is coming from the same place as someone going to a fancy restaurant and trying to fit in, therefore overdressing and feeling the need  to leave a very big tip depsite poor service in order to not feel less than or poor. Most of these mass-manufactured niche perfumes are subpar really and most do not smell extra at all. This one very dissappointing like the other ones, at the price point it seems ridiculous.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2114137"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2114137#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2113962" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2113962" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="christinamariev"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2083481"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2083481.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="christinamariev" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Roses-Vanille-15210.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15210.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Roses Vanille"title="Roses Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2113962ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2113962" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2083481">christinamariev</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-04">04/04/24 07:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yall, I wanted to love this.. but.. Its heavy on something that I cant get with.  Its either the aldehydes or the musk. Its not a horrible scent but its not something I want in my collection. Would not consider the scent unique/ interesting either but it does preform well. I enjoy most musk perfumes but this one I had to get rid off. I can see how this could be an appealing clean and cotton scent but I think I was expecting something with a little more femininity or softness. Im sure my body chemistry plays a role considering reviews are mixed. Some people absolutely love this and some dont so if you enjoy musk I recommend sampling first!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2113962"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2113962#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2113732" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2113732" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Velvetta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701017"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1701017.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Velvetta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Bouquet-Ideale-11800.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11800.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bouquet Ideale"title="Bouquet Ideale"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2113732ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2113732" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701017">Velvetta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-04">04/04/24 01:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm currently testing travel size bottle and it's really beautiful and surprisingly for such a soft scent - it stays long on skin and clothes and i think it has a decent projection. I think it works better applied by walking into the "cloud" of scent, instead of typical sprays on puls points. It creates a nice scent bubble then :) It's very pretty but expensive, but if you are really crazy about it,it's worth it i guess. There are many similar scents tho, like Fleur Narcotique is definitely A BIT similar, i even get some resemblence to J'adore - because at least of my skin and to my nose it's basically a mix of sparkly fresh peach and white flowers. They definitely belong to the same scent family and you can tell. It's a repleacable fragrance in my opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2113732"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2113732#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2112504" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2112504" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vinky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2059233"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2059233.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vinky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Huda-Beauty/Easy-Bake-91696.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91696.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Easy Bake"title="Easy Bake"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2112504ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2112504" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2059233">vinky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-02">04/02/24 22:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>* Initial review:<br />
<br />
Somewhat clean and somewhat floral, dries down to mostly aldehydes, musk, and vanilla. <br />
<br />
The initial spray is quite spicy-peppery but goes away quickly... Once fully dried down. where others smell woodiness I smell the pepper once again but very lightly. <br />
<br />
They don't smell very similar but I feel that a lot of the words used to describe Lazy Sunday Morning by Margiela would also be used to describe Valaya. Their end product don't smell all too similar, much of which I would attribute to the vanilla found in this, despite sharing quite a few notes in their pyramids. It pulls much warmer and skin-like because of it.<br />
<br />
It's interesting reading through all of the reviews as everyone seems to have entirely different descriptions for this fragrance. <br />
<br />
Very inoffensive, especially after it dries down. I would actually consider it Le Labo Another 13's more feminine, sliiiightly sparkling counterpart.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2112504"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2112504#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2111985" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2111985" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cats_eye"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/991427"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.991427.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cats_eye" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Musk-of-Flowers-15206.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15206.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musk of Flowers"title="Musk of Flowers"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2111985ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2111985" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/991427">cats_eye</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-02">04/02/24 11:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After wearing this one for a while it's really grown on me. The touch of vanilla in the base makes it unique. It's fresh and woodsy but also warm and musky. It's very concentrated and heavy on the musk so you might not smell it after a while but everyone else will. Yet you'll still get whiffs here and here. Something about it reminds me of Nautica for women from 1997 which was actually a very high quality fragrance with real lasting power. It left a sheen on your skin due to the high concentration. In a way these are all descendants of CK One.. Citrusy peach and white florals on a musky woods base. Light Blue (less warm and woodsy and musky) and Fleur Narcotique (more floral less musk). Unfortunately Ck1 was reformulated about 15 years ago ..and Nautica was discontinued. Valaya is great but remember it's basically parfum strength so don't spray too much because you'll be choking people without realizing it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2111985"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2111985#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2110808" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
