Kinda disappointing, but also kinda not because I dont have $300 to drop on perfume</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2110808"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2110808#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2110610" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2110610" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marli1973"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/136525"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.136525.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marli1973" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/Lalibela-2783.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2783.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lalibela"title="Lalibela"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2110610ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2110610" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/136525">Marli1973</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-01">04/01/24 06:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Uplifting but calming. Clean cocoon silky cotton blend smell.  A perfume that doesnt feel like wearing a perfume as such. Just a clean and elegant scent. <br />
A white roll neck cashmere sweater comes to mind equally a laid back white linen shirt. <br />
Great for everyday, any given environment. Unisex but a bit more feminine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2110610"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2110610#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108230" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2108230" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Snicole82"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/765170"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.765170.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Snicole82" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Lilac-Love-35624.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35624.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lilac Love"title="Lilac Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2108230ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2108230" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/765170">Snicole82</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 15:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is very, very fresh and clean. Too much for my taste. Very musky and aldehydic. I think if you like that with a touch of florals for Spring, then go for it. Its a little too bland for me. Good longevity, light sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2108230"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2108230#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2107956" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2107956" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KatiaMarie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074932"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2074932.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KatiaMarie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/L-Eau-Papier-78658.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78658.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau Papier"title="L'Eau Papier"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2107956ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2107956" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074932">KatiaMarie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 09:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Headache in a bottle. Sickly White floral overkill (Lily of the valley?) with dryer sheets. Can't decide if it smells like a grandma or a headache, or both.<br />
<br />
Yes - now after a while I can tell that it's the extremely indolic white flowers that give a not sweet, but more rotting fruit smell underneath the aldehyde bomb.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2107956"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2107956#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2104210" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2104210" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Heavenly Heather"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317582"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1317582.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Heavenly Heather" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2104210ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2104210" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317582">Heavenly Heather</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-25">03/25/24 19:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Finally getting around to testing my sample from Luckyscent. Its a very pretty sparkling fresh fruity floral. Opens up somewhat sharp from the aldehydes at top. On my skin the peach really stands out along with the florals &amp; a soft vanilla that lingers in the background. Its fresh, yet musky and a bit woody as well. Perfect fragrance for spring. I like it but expected more, reminds me a lot of Fleur Narcotique which I already own so Im not sure I need both. I can definitely see the appeal though &amp; think its one that many could make a signature scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2104210"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2104210#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2103663" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2103663" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amnebe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1645213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1645213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amnebe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Wood-Sage-Sea-Salt-25529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"title="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2103663ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2103663" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1645213">amnebe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-25">03/25/24 09:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I feel like I have a love/hate relationship with Quentin Bisch creations. Sadly, this one's a hate. The moment I put it on, it reminded me of one of those gel-based bathroom deodorizers from the 1980s. It's strongly floral and never relents with its strong and screechy note. I just feel like I smell like a bathroom. This isn't the first bathroom scent of his that I've hated. The first was ELDO Experimentum Crucis, which smells like a 1980s scented bathroom tissue to me. Put these two together, and you'd have the full going-to-the-bathroom-at-grandma's-in-the-1980s experience. This won't put me off trying Quentin Bisch fragrances because he has some real diamonds. This one just isn't it for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2103663"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2103663#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="78574" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1797948" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1797948" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alanav09"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/64428"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.64428.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alanav09" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Bianco-Latte-64757.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64757.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bianco Latte"title="Bianco Latte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1797948ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1797948" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/64428">alanav09</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-01">04/01/23 10:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am thrilled I didnt pay attention to most of the reviews here. please remember that everything is subjective, especially when it comes down to your hormones/skin chemistry. now, without further ado: <br />
<br />
sniffing the bottle, I get photo-realistic white florals, aldehydes, musk, citrus. on first blast, I get a very fancy light blue. a few seconds in, the peach peeks through, with the white floral notes and the ambroxan and musk in the background. it smells like a cool breeze wafting through a white-floral dense meadow on a hot day. <br />
<br />
does it smell like detergent? no. for reference, I think Liquid Diamonds from V&amp;R smelled like straight up Tide. this does smell crisp and clean, but if you have a detergent that smells like this - please point me in the direction, I will bathe in it. <br />
<br />
does it smell like Oriana? no. thats the most mind boggling comparison to me ... I get 0 powder from this. some of these reviews had me worried this would smell like a peach flavored tums chewable LOL. this has a light, sweet peach that peaks through the airy notes, but nothing like Oriana, which smells like fruit-flavored marshmallows. <br />
<br />
beast mode? scrubber? loud? could be, if you hate musk. I myself love musk, but I find this to be lighter, quieter, softer than Initio's Musk Therapy. Beast mode - oh ya. I put a few spritzes on yesterday afternoon*** and can still smell it on as I type this, pre-shower, the following morning. I still smell the peach, the musk, ambroxan, light white florals. <br />
<br />
this is quite possibly the closest contender I have found for a signature scent - I have not come across anything that I would consider a true dupe, and I am absolutely living.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="1797948"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=1797948#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2249002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2249002" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bkingstar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219962"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2219962.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bkingstar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jovoy-Paris/Remember-Me-49435.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49435.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Remember Me"title="Remember Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2249002ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2249002" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219962">bkingstar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-14">08/14/24 10:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the scent I have been dreaming of all my life. I wasn't drawn to it immediately but as I returned to it after it dried down, I felt like I had been graced by the presence of an angel. When people think of me, I want them to smell this. A man would think about you for the rest of his life if he smelled this on you. It makes me feel otherworldly, like I've transcended human form and am the embodiment of everything that is beautiful in the world. It is a spiritual and religious experience every time I wear this. It smells like the color light blue, swans, doves, flower fields, clouds, air, sun, and everything that is pure and fresh. This will be with me until I croak and will be my wedding scent </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2249002"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2249002#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2100511" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2100511" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Isabella Therese"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337526"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1337526.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Isabella Therese" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Houbigant/Ambre-Rubis-97383.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97383.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambre Rubis"title="Ambre Rubis"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2100511ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2100511" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337526">Isabella Therese</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-22">03/22/24 06:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Valaya is the misunderstood girl in the class who has so much to offer but is constantly standing in the shadow of the popular Delina. I love Delina too, don't get me wrong, but Valaya is just as amazing. Valaya is not sharp or screechy on my skin. She takes me back to my childhood, at my grandparents house. It's a sunny summer day in the North of Sweden, I'm eight years old with long hair and a sundress, the fresh laundry is hanging outside and the wind is blowing. I smell a mix of summer air, sun-dried sheets, flowers and peaches with just a touch of sweetness. Valaya is a veil (a strong and powerful one, but still) of clean, feminine, musky, floral fruitiness. She's a warm summer breeze and a cold freshness at the same time. Signature scent worthy. Valaya is a bit too strong to wear when it's really hot outside, but she's amazing in the spring. 9/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2100511"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2100511#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1912508" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1912508" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="crisjoy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/98418"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.98418.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="crisjoy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Antoine-Barrois/Tilia-91688.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91688.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tilia"title="Tilia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1912508ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1912508" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/98418">crisjoy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-27">08/27/23 01:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I rarely get excited about a perfume nowadays, but this one really made me giddy. I know it got a lot of hate, but I couldn't help but love it. Clean, floral, citrusy, I agree to people saying it's a mix of Delina, Fleur narcotique and Light blue. It is very airy but makes a statement at the same time, it got me a ton of compliments. A perfume I will keep in my collection for a long time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="1912508"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=1912508#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2070502" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2070502" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emeraldnyl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1697469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1697469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="emeraldnyl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vilhelm-Parfumerie/Poets-of-Berlin-49306.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49306.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Poets of Berlin"title="Poets of Berlin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2070502ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2070502" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1697469">emeraldnyl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-22">02/22/24 10:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Well, I was all set to purchase Meliora until I wore my sample of Valaya to work today and received 4 compliments (they even asked me to write down the name). I rarely get compliments, so I guess Im buying this first! I have several musky scents already (Myth, 11 11, Mojave Ghost, Clean Skin, Another 13) but this one is different enough to justify a purchase. Its elevated dryer sheets in the best way possible whereas many other musky scents veer more towards luxe shampoo. And unlike most other musky scents, the performance is AMAZING.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2070502"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2070502#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="78574" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1754449" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1754449" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="harperpeshhe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1322710"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1322710.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="harperpeshhe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/CoSTUME-NATIONAL/So-Nude-15377.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15377.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="So Nude"title="So Nude"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1754449ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1754449" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1322710">harperpeshhe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-07">02/07/23 15:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nope. Fresh clean sunbleached white cotton sheets that have been forgotten on the line for more than a week during the rain. Not soft or comforting, but quite harsh and scratchy. Something in this is quite piercing. Unfortunately this one was a scrubber for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="1754449"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=1754449#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1779253" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1779253" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="funnycolorliquid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/401671"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="funnycolorliquid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Elevator-Music-48821.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48821.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elevator Music"title="Elevator Music"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1779253ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1779253" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/401671">funnycolorliquid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-09">03/09/23 11:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really had high hopes for this but it was totally underwhelming. It's like I want to love all the Parfums de Marly perfumes but there is always one note that is offputting (on my skin). Sharp and synthetic citrus, bathroom cleaner. <br />
<br />
Light Blue and Fleur Narcotique had a baby, but she ain't that cute.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="1779253"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=1779253#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1766937" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1766937" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Linnsim"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1534152"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1534152.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Linnsim" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1766937ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1766937" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1534152">Linnsim</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-22">02/22/23 20:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An aldehydic bomb. It turned out sour and extremely aldehydic on my skin, had to rub it off. I had high expectations since I love Fleur Narcotique and D&amp;G Light Blue and its compared to those, but IMO I dont get the comparison at all.. You have to like aldehydes and Chanel no 5 style of fragrances to like this one. For me its a pass</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="1766937"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=1766937#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2053502" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2053502" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DarlingNikki"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.6977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DarlingNikki" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2053502ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2053502" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6977">DarlingNikki</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-05">02/05/24 23:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells so bad to me but I want to be objective and try to explain why.  There is something very synthetic, off-putting, bizarre, and molecular about this smell.  I get images of Xerox copy paper (yes I'm that old lol), industrial solvents used to clean stuck on glue or deeply embedded grease, fresh ink being blown dry by a hot, arid wind, a burning light bulb...even the remnants of vodka in a cold glass.  Yes, there is an unwelcome coldness to this scent (and I do get that annoying BR540 vibe too unfortunately), as if an Ice Queen would marinate herself in this to keep people at bay.  Hideously strong, nose-piercingly sharp, and not understandable to me as a scent.  This is the smell of Chernobyl the morning after the disaster or what it might smell like being stuck inside an empty silo that once had every synthetic molecule used in perfumey stored inside of it.  This is WTF am I smelling in a bottle lol!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2053502"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2053502#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2221319" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2221319" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aland2020"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1187053"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1187053.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aland2020" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Moonlight-in-Heaven-35973.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35973.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Moonlight in Heaven"title="Moonlight in Heaven"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2221319ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2221319" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1187053">Aland2020</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-17">07/17/24 09:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, what a mess. This smells like what all the negative reviews were saying. I normally don't read reviews before writing my own but I really couldn't express what was happening on my skin, and I was perplexed. It's a peachy synthetic musky mess. The aldehyde musk combo does smell like a bleach on steroids. This is what Not A Perfume would probably evolve into when she gets married and becomes a rich D***** bag's housewife. This is for the person who buys all neutral beige baby toys. An all white bouncy castle for the 1st birthday party, nevermind that the child can't even walk yet. Dresses her children in suspendered shorts, boat shoes, and a button down or cotillion dress and white tights year round. Hosts tea parties in the garden and gets drunk at noon because the nanny will fetch the children for their baths in time for a dinner to feed 45 people and all she eats is a fork full of rice and half a piece of asparagus then claims she's full. Her husband hasn't been home in 3 nights because he's been stuck at the office closing a business deal and his secretary Sarah has to be there with him. <br />
<br />
This is for the woman who has now gotten older and gets a seasoned employee at Neiman Marcus fired for accidentally sneezing in her presence and then cries during Sunday Service about God's enduring grace and love. She tries on dresses at her daughter's wedding gown fitting. She cries in the hospital holding her first grandchild, hoping she looks the part but on the inside she's seething with rage because she's been in denial all these years about her true age and has had enough botox injected in her smile lines to calm the aftershocks of a 4.7 earthquake. She insists the child call her "Gigi", she now has a fluffy white dog that she takes everywhere in her crocodile Birkin bag and they eat off of the same fork at restaurants. Her husband died of a heart attack in his sleep many years ago, and she has never taken another lover. She lives comfortably in their house with that beautiful garden. Sarah died of mysterious causes, and so did many of her husbands secretaries, it must have been all the stress that her husband put them through. But all of the begonias she planted in their honor bloom yearly and make her smile. <br />
<br />
She dies and donates all of her riches and wealth to charity, with a long speech about righting wrongs read to her room full of children and grandchildren as they sob with the realization they'll be left with nothing. Her final request is that they bury her in the cream Chanel suit and spray her generously with Valaya, then they tuck the bottle and her taxidermied pooch under her arms and close the casket. <br />
<br />
Whatever petalia is I want to be sure I never try another perfume with it. It's clearly sent me on some psychosis-laced journey of horror. You wanna know how it smells? Cold and heartless served up with a slice of peach pie and a glass of bleach water. Like someone stuck their head inside of a dryer filled with fluffy white towels and then asphyxiated and died.I'm sure that on some people it's a sweet dream, yet on me it was a nightmare that I hope to never experience again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="78574"comment_id="2221319"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html?ccid=2221319#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="78574" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="78574":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="78574" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

        <div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Reviews</span></div>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
